album.title: Sinatra Reprise: The Very Good Years

wiki.content: Frank Sinatra recorded this song on his 1964 album 'It Might as Well Be Swing', accompanied by Count Basie, under the direction of Quincy Jones. It was the last song Sinatra sang in public, on February 25, 1995, and the words "The Best is Yet to Come" are etched on Sinatra's tombstone. Though Sinatra made it popular, the song was actually written for and introduced by Tony Bennett. User-contributed text is available under the Creative Commons By-SA License and may also be available under the GNU FDL.
wiki.summary: Frank Sinatra recorded this song on his 1964 album 'It Might as Well Be Swing', accompanied by Count Basie, under the direction of Quincy Jones. It was the last song Sinatra sang in public, on February 25, 1995, and the words "The Best is Yet to Come" are etched on Sinatra's tombstone. Though Sinatra made it popular, the song was actually written for and introduced by Tony Bennett.

track.name: The Best Is Yet To Come
comments: The quality of this particular recording is terrible.
I actually prefer the Vic & Sisko version.
but baby, you ain't left the ground!
Terrible recording...why is this being offered?
we’ve only tasted the wine, we’re gonna drain our cups dryyyy !
Great tune, but was this recorded underwater on cassette recorder???!!!  Come on!
This is one of Frank's best tracks.
con esta música el mundo se detiene...
Frank is great, the song is great but this recording sucks!!!! Why would last.fm play a recording of this quality?
This is  Frank Sinatra and Jon Secada two very very good artists, making a very very good song, yet I must agree Frankie is much better alone....
